steps.description: Measure and add-a pinch of salt to the mixing bowl
Measure and add-1/4 tsp baking powder to the bowl
steps.modified_description: Measure and add-1/2 tsp baking powder to the bowl

errors.description: Add more baking powder. Might give bitter taste to the cupcake

steps.description: Measure and add-1.5 tbsp sugar to the mixing bowl
steps.modified_description: Measure and add-2 tbsp sugar to the mixing bowl

errors.description: Add more sugar. Might make the cake very sweet

steps.description: Measure and add-Measure and add 2 tbsp flour to the mixing bowl
Whisk-Whisk to combine mixture of flour, sugar and baking powder in the bowl
steps.modified_description: (NOT ENOUGH) Whisk-Whisk to combine mixture of flour, sugar and baking powder in the bowl

steps.description: Measure and add-2 tbsp water to the bowl
Measure and add-Measure and add 2 tsp vegetable oil to the bowl
Measure and add-1/4 tsp vanilla extract to the bowl
Place-Place the paper cupcake liner inside the mug
steps.modified_description: Place-Place the FOLDED paper cupcake liner inside the mug

errors.description: Folded paper cupcake liner will not cover the bottom of the cup fully

steps.description: Whisk-Whisk batter until no lumps remain

errors.description: Do not whisk enough - lumps will lead to bad output

steps.description: Microwave-Microwave the mug and batter on high power for 60 seconds. Check if the cake is done by inserting and toothpick into the center of the cake and then removing it. If wet batter clings to the toothpick, microwave for an additional 5 seconds. If the toothpick comes out clean, continue
steps.modified_description: Microwave-Microwave the mug and batter on high power for 90 seconds. Check if the cake is done by inserting and toothpick into the center of the cake and then removing it. If wet batter clings to the toothpick, microwave for an additional 15 seconds. If the toothpick comes out clean, continue

errors.description: Microwave for 90 seconds. Might burn the cupcake

steps.description: Invert-Invert the mug to release the cake onto a plate
Allow-Allow to cool until it is no longer hot to the touch
remove-then carefully remove the paper liner

errors.description: Break the cupcake while removing the paper linear

steps.description: Scoop-While the cake is cooling, prepare to pipe the frosting. Scoop 4 spoonfuls of chocolate frosting into a zip-top bag
steps.modified_description: Scoop-While the cake is cooling, prepare to pipe the frosting. Scoop 1 spoonfuls of chocolate powder into a zip-top bag

errors.description: Take only 1 spoon, will not be enough for the forsting

steps.description: seal-seal zip top bag, removing as much air as possible
cut-Use scissors to cut one corner from the bag to create a small opening 1/4 inch in diameter
steps.modified_description: cut-Use scissors to cut one corner from the bag to create a small opening 1/2 inch in diameter

errors.description: Make a big cut. This will lead to bigger frosting
Squeeze-Squeeze the frosting through the opening to apply small dollops of frosting to the plate in a circle around the base of the cake
